[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [File Write Race] If multiple errmap commands target the same output_file concurrently, does file locking prevent data corruption, or can interleaved writes produce corrupted error maps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Default Prefix Bypass] When error_prefix is None, does ErrmapOptions::default() use a secure default, or can this be exploited to bypass error filtering and expose all constants as errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [ModelConfig Defaults] Are ModelConfig defaults (all_files_as_targets: true) safe, or does this cause excessive file processing that could trigger vulnerabilities in model building? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Lossy String Conversion] Does to_string_lossy() on output_file path cause security issues if non-UTF8 paths are silently converted, potentially masking path traversal attempts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Extension Confusion] Can with_extension() be exploited with output_file names containing multiple dots (e.g., 'file.tar.gz') to produce unexpected extensions that bypass security policies? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Path Component Injection] Does PathBuf handling properly sanitize path components, or can special characters in output_file (e.g., ':', '\\') cause platform-specific vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Privilege Escalation] If the CLI runs with elevated privileges (e.g., in Docker containers), can malicious output_file paths write to system directories, escalating privileges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Umask Bypass] Does save_result() respect system umask settings, or can it create error map files with overly permissive permissions (e.g., world-writable) that leak sensitive error information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Capability Leakage] Can error map files inherit dangerous capabilities from the CLI process, making them exploitable for privilege escalation in containerized environments? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Dependencies] [Malicious Crate] Does move_errmapgen crate come from a trusted source, or could a compromised version inject malicious code during error map generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Dependencies] [Dependency Confusion] Can attackers publish malicious move_errmapgen or move_command_line_common crates to public registries that take precedence over internal versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Build Script Execution] Does move_model_for_package() trigger build.rs scripts in dependencies that could execute arbitrary code during error map generation? (Critical)
